Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 146 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams are near the point of no return, with two points each from four games
England have tried shrugging off defeat, they have tried 'letting it hurt', they have tried the old 'go harder' mantras
England's batting has misfired more than anyone expected, with just one century and four fifties so far
Sri Lanka have shown glimpses of their abilities, mainly through Kusal Mendis and Sadeera Samarawickrama with the bat
Miscellaneous Highlights: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium has a reputation for high-scoring games and lived up to it when the World Cup finally arrived in Bengaluru
The strip for Thursday's match is slightly off-centre, with an invitingly short boundary towards neighbouring Cubbon Park
Others: Jos Buttler needs 90 runs to become the fifth Englishman to 5000 in ODIs
Joe Root needs 70 for 1000 at World Cups
Maheesh Theekshana is four wickets shy of 50
